required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Concurrent Membrane Sweeping With Dinoprostone Versus Dinoprostone in Labor Induction of Nulliparas at Term With an Unfavorable Cervix

brief_summary.textblock: To compare concurrent membrane sweeping with dinoprostone versus dinoprostone in labor induction for nulliparas at term with an unfavorable cervix

primary_outcome.time_frame: Twenty-four hours of initiating intervention (i.e. membrane sweeping or PG) on the first day of induction
primary_outcome.description: Vaginal delivery within 24 hours is defined as vaginal delivery after 24 hours of initiating intervention (i.e. concurrent membrane sweeping with dinoprostone or only dinoprostone) on the first day of induction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cervical change in the bishop scores and cervical lengths
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Initiation of oxytocin after removing dinoprostone vaginal insert
secondary_outcome.description: Cervical change based on the bishop score and cervical length induced by two cervical ripening methods(concurrent membrane sweeping with dinoprostone vs. dinoprostone) Incidence of cesarean delivery Successful labor induction (defined as an ability to achieve the active phase of labor corresponding to a cervical dilatation of >=4cm). The interval from start of oxytocin to delivery Incidence of rupture of membranes Incidences of vaginal bleeding and fever

clinical_study.condition: Nulliparous Women Who Scheduled for Labor Induction

intervention.description: Women assigned to "Sweep" had their cervix swept by inserting the examining finger as high as possible past the internal cervical os, immediately followed by the placement of a 10mg Dinoprostone vaginal insert in the posterior fornix.
For women assigned to "No sweep": The only 10mg Dinoprostone vaginal insert were placed in the posterior fornix for cervical ripening

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- singleton pregnancy
- Nulliparous women
- gestational age >=37.0 weeks
- Bishop score <=6
- intact amniotic membrane
- absence of labor
- live fetus with vertex presentation
- no previous uterine surgical procedure
Exclusion Criteria:
- Multiple pregnancy
- Placenta previa

facility.name: Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology Seoul National University Bundang Hospital
